meanings.definition: To use up or consume wastefully or extravagantly.
meanings.sent1: She outwasted all her money on unnecessary things.
meanings.sent2: The party guests outwasted the food and drinks in no time.
meanings.sent3: He outwasted his allowance on video games, leaving nothing for essentials.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire outwasted the forest, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The careless shopper outwasted her budget on items she didn't need.

meanings.definition: To surpass in wasting or consuming.
meanings.sent1: The hungry teenager outwasted his friends in pizza eating competition.
meanings.sent2: The old car outwasted its fuel much quicker than the new one.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner outwasted his energy too soon and couldn't finish the race.
meanings.sent4: The voracious reader outwasted all the books in the library in a month.
meanings.sent5: The growing puppy outwasted its food bowl every mealtime.
